items.title: "Blanco, her husband, came to the U.S. in 2005 and lived...
items.content_html:
Abolish ICE Denver

"Blanco, her husband, came to the U.S. in 2005 and lived and worked in the country without legal status until 2011, when a car crash put him on federal authorities’ radars. Ever since, he’s been fighting for a pathway to remain in the country and avoid deportation back to El Salvador.

It’s not uncommon for cases like his to take the better part of a decade. As people navigate the country’s complicated, constantly changing legal landscape, they’re usually granted permission to... work. Blanco was holding down a job at a restaurant until COVID-19 restrictions meant his hours whittled away to nothing. Though taxes from his wages paid into Colorado’s unemployment insurance system, his status meant he wasn’t allowed to benefit from that program. His family was also ineligible for the congressional stimulus checks issued last year.

The money he and Martinez make from the food they sell helps them feed their two children and stay engaged in Blanco’s case."

See MorePresident Biden's new direction on immigration is giving some hope as financial stability continues to drop beneath them.

denverite.com

Undocumented Denverites can't file for unemployment, so families got creative to keep the bills paid

President Biden's new direction on immigration is giving some hope as financial stability continues to drop beneath them.President Biden's new direction on immigration is giving some hope as financial stability continues to drop beneath them.

items.title: Today Joe Biden signed several executive orders. One was widely...
items.content_html:
Abolish ICE Denver

Today Joe Biden signed several executive orders. One was widely hailed as “the end of private prisons.” I saw major media organizations and leading political leaders literally tweet that Biden just issued an executive order “ending private prisons.”⁣
⁣
Except NO SUCH THING happened. ⁣
⁣
The overwhelming majority of private prisons are state-based. 100% of those private prisons will continue. ⁣...
⁣
But not only will 100% of city, county, and state based private prisons continue to operate, the majority of federal private prisons and detention centers, which are immigration detention centers, will continue as well. Biden’s executive order didn’t cover any of those. ⁣
⁣
About 8% of all incarcerated people are housed in private prisons. Most of those people will remain in private prisons. ⁣
⁣
92% of all incarcerated people are in public facilities. Worse, Biden’s executive order appears to impact only a microscopic amount of the already tiny percentage of people held in private prisons. ⁣
⁣
One expert today told me that Biden’s announcement would impact such a tiny percentage of people that he didn’t actually have a number for it – because it’s less than half of a percent. And they are simply going to be moved to other prisons - not released. ⁣
⁣
This is performative change. It’s more than nothing, but at the same time somewhere in the ballpark of a half step above nothing. To actually confront this problem, it’s going to take a lot of more than this. ⁣
⁣
On the list of things that could be done, this doesn’t crack the top 25. It’s performative. Fluff. Nothing changes.

See More

items.title: It’s our last sale of the month! Two families will be working...
items.content_html:
Abolish ICE Denver

It’s our last sale of the month! Two families will be working together to make burritos, and the money will go toward an emergency fund, rather than the families cooking. The growth of this fund is incredibly important to the families who lead Sanctuary4All because it provides security in case anyone is unexpectedly detained and needs money quickly for legal representation. You can order a burrito at solidaritymeals.paperform.co

Rep. Joe Neguse, D-Colo., and his colleagues on the House Judiciary Committee on Wednesday evening sent a letter to Vice President Pence asking him to invoke the 25th Amendment and remove Donald Trump from office.

“For the sake of our democracy, we emphatically urge you to invoke the 25th Amendment and begin the process of removing President Trump from power,” the lawmakers wrote. “President Trump has shown time and again that he is unwilling to protect our Democracy and carry out the duties of the office.” https://bit.ly/35eNzsy

items.title: This New Year’s Eve, please join the @denvercommunists and other activists across the Colorado Front Range who have...
items.content_html:
This New Year’s Eve, please join the @denvercommunists and other activists across the Colorado Front Range who have organized a noise demonstration in solidarity with our incarcerated neighbors and political prisoners like anarchist, activist, and poet, Eric King.

What better way is there to show solidarity other than showing up, making some noise & closing out this shit show of a year together? Show up with your best NYE noise makers, demonstration banners and signs. Who knows, we may even try out a new flavor of Pig face? Fed or Jeffco anyone?

We are planning on meeting up at Harriman Lake Park at 7:30 pm at W Quincy Ave & S. Kipling Pkwy, then heading to the facility which is across the street at 9595 W Quincy Ave Littleton, CO 80123.

**Neither we, nor the other organizers of this action, are affiliated in any way with Eric King nor the Eric King Support team @SupportEricKing. We all just want to show some love and and we are happy to signal boost that!**

“I have been incredibly fortunate to have so many people come into my life and take a stand with me so that I didn’t have to face this shit alone… From the smallest greeting to the big gestures, everything has meant so much to me… Now that said, I stand by my actions... After seeing what happened in Ferguson, so close down the road, I was disgusted by the lack of mobilization in my city. Three hours away people were fighting for their lives and we weren’t even taking to the streets. We were doing nothing. My act as a very personal display of my anger and rage toward the state as well as an act of solidarity to everyone in Ferguson. We never know our own strength until we are tested and even with my ridiculous sentence I feel at least proud to have been able to stand strong and refuse to cooperate with the state. I am just really happy that I don’t have to take this alone and have so many amazing people standing next to me. Until all are free.”
— Eric King

https://unicornriot.ninja/2016/eric-king-given-10-yr-sentence-throwing-molotovs-empty-govt-building/

items.title: Join us Friday, December 18 at 7 p.m. for a premiere virtual screening of “The Facility.” ...
items.content_html:
Join us Friday, December 18 at 7 p.m. for a premiere virtual screening of “The Facility.”

“The Facility” is a short documentary film chronicling the lived experiences of immigrants being held at the GEO detention facility in Aurora, Colorado. This film addresses the personal loss and consequences caused by for-profit detention and the federal government's broken immigration policies. Legal and medical experts highlight horrific abuses including death, medical neglect, nutrition issues, and prolonged detention during the coronavirus pandemic. To tell their stories, current and former detainees, families fighting to be reunited, and advocates come together to share their experiences behind the walls of the GEO immigration detention facility in Aurora.

@acluofcolorado @coloradopeoplesalliance @co_immigrant @keshagrijalva @_floodlight_

Following the screening will be a Q&A session with the director, legal experts, and individuals featured in the film with first-hand experience of the systemic abuse occurring inside the facility.

Panelists include:

Jeremy Flood, “The Facility” Director
Raul Medina Perez, COPA, Community Organizer who was formerly detained at GEO
Kesha Davalos Grijalva, Immigrant rights advocate whose husband is detained at GEO
Keinada Andereas, Colorado Student who was formerly detained at GEO
Hans Meyer, The Meyer Law Office, Lead Attorney
Denise Maes, ACLU of Colorado, Public Policy Director

Please RSVP for the screening in advance for this free event: https://aclu.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_nUbTy8-VQpif8nMzqtUzQw

Trailer: https://youtu.be/cGOCejy48Jo

“The Facility” is presented by ACLU of Colorado, Colorado Immigrant Rights Coalition, and Colorado Hispanic Bar Association.

items.title: Since we began fighting with Elijah McClain's family 15 months ago, power has done everything possible to serve power...
items.content_html:
Since we began fighting with Elijah McClain's family 15 months ago, power has done everything possible to serve power and silence us.

However, this state repression only fans the People's flames!

Those in power tried to take away public comment at city council, the DA's still have Elijah classified as a suspect, fascists have burned down his memorial multiple times, the kops took disgusting reenactment photos of Elijah's murder (the only kop fired so far has been fired for taking these depraved photos), a city councilman sicked the far right on us on with the assistance of a local Nazi radio station, the kops helped a bro attempt to run us over on the highway (breaking a woman's leg), the kops tear-gassed us, beat us, and then two DA's put our comrades in jail for 8 days without a bond hearing and are STILL trying to keep them in cages for for up to 40 YEARS. And now Democratic governor @govofco and @philforcolorado -after the Adams and Arapahoe DA's and APD tried to cage the movement-thinks we aren't going to notice the weak ass shit he is pulling with the state investigation during Thanksgiving holiday?!? APD also tried to release body cam footage to the family and media last Thanksgiving thinking people wouldn't notice!

Democrat politicians always call for "investigations" and "studies" to silence and tire activists and Polis is doing more of the same. Polis knew about Elijah before this summer. Polis knew all along. Let's be real: calling for an investigation into police murder is the Dem Party equivalent of "thoughts and prayers."

We will not take down these watered-down concessions from Dems! Elijah's mother wants these cops and paramedics PROSECUTED

We are watching, we won't stop fighting and we will march and dance and holler until Elijah's mother gets what she asked for--and APD is fucking ABOLISHED

@justiceforelijahmcclain @denverpsl

items.title: Via AFSC Colorado...
items.content_html:
Via AFSC Colorado

***sigue en espanol ***

With the recent outbreak, COVID 19 threatens the lives of everyone imprisoned. #DetentionIsDeadly.

Immigration and Customs Enforcement’s decision to return to business as usual and its GEO detention center in Aurora are not keeping our community safe, and experts agree, the only answer is to #FreeThemAll. Just last month, Dr. Carlos Franco Paredes called for compassionate humanitarian release of all imprisoned people. Join us Monday, November 9th at 6:00 pm at 3130 Oakland in Aurora for a Caravan around the detention center and virtually on FB Live. We will hear from family and impacted individuals and from the Colorado Immigrant Freedom Fund about how your donations can free our people! This event is brought to you by the American Friends Service Committee, the Colorado People’s Alliance, the Colorado Freedom Fund AND the Immigrant Freedom Fund of Colorado.

Con el reciente brote, COVID 19 amenaza la vida de todos los encarcelados. #DetentionIsDeadly. La decisión del Servicio de Inmigración y Control de Aduanas de volver a la normalidad y su centro de detención GEO en Aurora no mantiene a nuestra comunidad segura, y los expertos coinciden en que la única respuesta es #FreeThemAll. El mes pasado, el Dr. Carlos Franco Paredes pidió la liberación humanitaria compasiva de todas las personas encarceladas. Únase a nosotros el lunes 9 de noviembre a las 6:00 pm en 3130 Oakland en Aurora para una caravana alrededor del centro de detención y virtualmente en FB Live. ¡Escucharemos a familiares e individuos afectados y al Fondo de Libertad de Inmigrantes de Colorado sobre cómo sus donaciones pueden liberar a nuestra gente! Este evento es presentado por el American Friends Service Committee, la Colorado People's Alliance, el Colorado Freedom Fund Y el Colorado Immigrant Freedom Fund.
❤🖤
